meanings.definition: Not pure or virtuous; lacking in moral or sexual purity.
meanings.sent1: The unchaste behavior of the character shocked the audience.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her unchaste actions at the party last night.
meanings.sent3: The unchaste squirrel stole all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The unchaste storm ravaged the peaceful town with its destructive winds.
meanings.sent5: The unchaste painting depicted scenes of debauchery and immorality.

meanings.sent1: The unchaste outfit she wore to the event raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent2: His unchaste jokes made everyone uncomfortable at the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: The unchaste cat paraded around with a feather boa and sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: The unchaste music video pushed the boundaries of decency.
meanings.sent5: The unchaste dance routine shocked the conservative audience.
